intro: Visenia polystachya, commonly known as the African sycamore, is a deciduous tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pale yellow flowers. The tree can grow up to 20 meters tall, with a broad, spreading canopy. Its bark is smooth and grayish-brown, often peeling in thin layers. The plant is adapted to dry climates and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats.
